meanings.definition: The ability of a material to withstand the effects of weather.
meanings.sent1: The weatherability of the roof tiles ensured they remained intact after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The durability of the outdoor furniture was due to its weatherability.
meanings.sent3: The weatherability of the umbrella saved the picnic from being ruined by the sudden rain.
meanings.sent4: Her weatherability was like a shield against the harsh elements of nature.
meanings.sent5: The weatherability of the sunscreen protected her skin from the scorching sun.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to resist damage or deterioration caused by exposure to weather conditions.
meanings.sent1: The weatherability of the paint prevented it from fading in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The weatherability of the car's exterior kept it looking new despite the rain.
meanings.sent3: His weatherability in handling the stormy weather was impressive.
meanings.sent4: The weatherability of the roof was tested during the heavy snowfall.
meanings.sent5: The weatherability of the fabric made it ideal for outdoor use.
